result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damari R Morgan

records.addlTxt: Defense Supplemental Proposed Jury Instruction; received and filed.
Defense Amended Supplemental Proposed Jury Instruction; received and filed.

Defendant Damari R Morgan appeared by video.  Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson appeared by video for Damari R Morgan.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final PreTrial with Co-Defendant Case, 21CF4187. Court reviewed Defense Motion. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. State placed offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. Court addressed Defense Motion. State did not object. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense Motion regarding Defendant's prior convictions. If Defendant chooses to testify, he has two criminal convictions. State further agreed that Defendant's statement at the hospital is NOT admissible. No additional issues need to be addressed at this time. Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Status hearing and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Jury Status hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:15 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. 
Jury Trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated October 20, 2022; received and filed.
Defense Witness List; received and filed.

Defense Motion to Determine the Admissibility of Mr. Damari Morgan's Statements Before the Government is Allowed to Admit them into Evidence either in the Case-in-Chief or in Rebuttal; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Defense Motion to Determine the Admissibility of Prior Convictions of Defendant Damari R. Morgan; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Defense Proposed Jury Instructions; received and filed.

Defendant Damari R Morgan appeared by video.  Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson appeared by video for Damari R Morgan.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** 
Case in Court for Final PreTrial with Co-Defendant Case, 21CF4187. Discussion placed on the record.  

Co-Defendant retained new counsel and requested an adjourned hearing. State did not object. Court orders case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial (as to both Defendants). Case remains calendared in Branch 46.  Final PreTrial hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Jury Trial scheduled for November 14 at 9:00 am. Trial will be held in person in room 113 of the Safety Building.
State's Witness List; received and filed.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions; received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine; received and filed.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated 09-13-2022; received and filed.

Defendant Damari R Morgan in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference with Co-Defendant Case, 21CF4187. Discussion placed on the record. Statements made regarding discovery material issues. Defense advised the court of the Motion to Withdraw Counsel. Statements made by Defendant. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIES Defense request.

Co-Defendant Counsel requested case be set for trial.  Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court orders case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial (as to both Defendants). Case remains calendared in Branch 46.  Final PreTrial hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Jury Trial scheduled for November 14 at 9:00 am. Trial will be held in person in room 113 of the Safety Building.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated July 14, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Damari R Morgan in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court of communication conflict with defendant. Statements made by Defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Scheduling Conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:25 pm. Hearing will be held Via Zoom Video Conference.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated 06-21-22; received and filed.

Defendant Damari R Morgan in Court with Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference with Co-Defendant Case, 21CF4187. Discussion placed on the record. Statements made regarding discovery material issues. Additionally, Defense advised the Court of Defendant's request for new counsel. Defendant confirmed. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing (as to Mr. Damari Morgan) and Status hearing (as to both Defendants). Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 
Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:25 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Status hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:25 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.  Status hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:25 pm.  Status hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:25 pm.

Defendant Damari R Morgan in Court with Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski on behalf of Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference with Co-Defendant Case, 21CF4187. Discussion placed on the record. Parties provided an update to the Court. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Court advised Defendant to continue compliance with JusticePoint. Status hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated April 26, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Damari R Morgan in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  BOTH APPEARED BY VIDEO.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective Matthew Bughman      Court took judicial notice of  08CF3193. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46 by zoom.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated April 14, 2022; received and filed.

Per CCAP entry in Case 21CF3992, Defendant did NOT provide a DNA Sample.
Court instructed Defendant to report to the G Level of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Defendant returned to Court and advised the Deputy that DNA was already on file.
Court ordered Defendant have NO CONTACT with Co-Defendant, Daquane Morgan.

Court ordered CASH BAIL FROM CASE 21CF3992 TO APPLY TO CASE 22CF893.
Court ordered Defendant TURNED OVER TO JUSTICE POINT FOR LEVEL 4 SUPERVISION. 
Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Damari R Morgan in Court with Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Initial Appearance. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. 
Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint. Court advised Defendant of maximum penalties, right to counsel, and right to a Preliminary hearing. Court reviewed Criminal Complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant can appear via Zoom Video Conference or IN-PERSON in Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Damari R Morgan in Court with Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Initial Appearance. Defendant appeared via Zoom Video Conference. Defense and State appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record. Earlier today the Defendant was evaluated by the Public Defender's Office. Defendant QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Hearing must be held IN-PERSON. Parties selected a new date. Court ordered case adjourned for Initial Appearance. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Initial Appearance scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 10:30 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
